abstracts.cdata!:
The Amman Solid Waste Management and
            Carbon Finance Project received the following ratings in its
            assessment of outcomes: 'High' for Objectives;
            'Modest' for Design and implementation;
            'Modest' for Achievement of Project Development
            Objectives; 'Negligible' for Efficiency; and
            'Moderately Unsatisfactory' for Overall Outcome
            Rating. It also received ratings in the following criteria:
            'Moderate' for Assessment of Risk to Development
            Outcome; 'Moderately Satisfactory' for Overall
            Bank Performance; and 'Moderately Unsatisfactory'
            for Overall Borrower Performance. Going forward it was
            determined that the Bank should be willing to take risks,
            including in innovative project concepts, but targets should
            be conservative and the restructuring bar should be set
            correspondingly low. It was also determined that carbon
            finance is a results-based instrument that is very closely
            linked to successful implementation of the underlying
            project, and that decisions regarding location of solid
            waste infrastructure in urban areas should be settled fully
            before appraisal. There were also instances where the Bank
            faced conflicts of interests, resulting from its
            representation of multiple stakeholders' interests in
            this project.
